Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; interior: glazed at top, reserved below; exterior: black over moulded ridge at join of neck and shoulder; at top of shoulder uneven tongue frieze, below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of wing, possibly from a siren or sphinx, to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 65, pl. 52, no. 232)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 222)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.226) (phase 3)
